newsitem.title: BULGARIA: Shell interested in Bulgarian oil refinery.
newsitem.headline: Shell interested in Bulgarian oil refinery.

text.p: The Shell Transport and Trading Co group has shown interest in the planned privatisation of Bulgaria's biggest oil refinery Neftochim, a company source said on Tuesday.
She said a senior official of the company's central and eastern Europe operations visited Sofia at the end of May and had talks with Bulgaria's Privatisation Agency.
Bulgaria plans to sell up to 75 percent of the indebted refinery.
Earlier this month Shell bought two filling stations and three filling stations sites from Amoco Corp, which has pulled out of petroleum retailing in eastern Europe.
Shell, which is now the only foreign petrol retailer in Bulgaria and has 25 stations, supplies its fuel from Neftochim.
Russia's Rosneft has already shown interest in the sale.
Industry officials said Bulgaria was seeking a foreign commercial bank to prepare Neftochim's sale, which could not be completed before the end of 1998.

Earlier this month the government ordered an audit of the refinery, which has posted a loss of 33.4 billion levs last year. A day later the shareholders' meeting of the refinery voted not to accept the plant's 1996 report and accounts.
Some 25 percent of the refinery was sold under Bulgaria's mass privatisation programme.
